page.syntax: Chars_Skipped as N = SkipOverCharacter as N(characters as c)

argument.name: Chars_Skipped
argument.description: The number of characters the offset has been moved.

argument.name: characters
argument.description: A list of characters to skip over. Case sensitive.

page.description: Skip until we are on a character not in the group. Return # of characters skipped over.
page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.SkipOverCharacter() function moves the offset to the next character not in the Chars list and returns the number of characters that the offset has moved. Note : The Chars argument is case sensitive.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This1234 is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of note. %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.SkipOverCharacter("this") = 0 ? scanner.skipovercharacter(" hisTw") = 9 ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is w" ? scanner.getremainder() = onderful prose written by a technical writer of note.
page.original:
&ltStringScanner>.SkipOverCharacter() Syntax Chars_Skipped as N = &ltStringScanner>.SkipOverCharacter( Chars as C ) ArgumentDescription Chars_SkippedThe number of characters the offset has been moved. CharsA list of characters to skip over. Case sensitive.
Description The &ltStringScanner>.SkipOverCharacter() function moves the offset to the next character not in the Chars list and returns the number of characters that the offset has moved. Note : The Chars argument is case sensitive. Examples dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = &lt&lt%text% This1234 is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of note. %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.SkipOverCharacter("this") = 0 ? scanner.skipovercharacter(" hisTw") = 9 ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is w" ? scanner.getremainder() = onderful prose written by a technical writer of note.
See Also StringScanner
